definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: It is a long and humble business.
sentences.chinese: 這是一項長期而卑下的任務。

sentences.english: Certainly here is the case where we're humbled by nature.
sentences.chinese: 確定地這裏是我們被天生卑下的情形。

sentences.english: Then their numbers decreased, and they were humbled by oppression, calamity and sorrow;
sentences.chinese: 他們又因暴虐，患難，愁苦，就減少且卑下。

sentences.english: Shall we resort to entreaty and humble supplication?
sentences.chinese: 我們應該訴諸和約和卑下的哀求嗎？

sentences.english: And man hath bowed himself down, and man hath been debased: therefore forgive them not.
sentences.chinese: 如此，人自甘卑下，自甘墮落，對他們決無救援。

definition: to deign/to condescend/to yield to (entreaties)/to submit to (sb)/(polite) to deign to accept (a post)
servile and bending the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
